title: The Scientist
album: A Rush of Blood to the Head
description: “The Scientist” is a very mellow song about trying to analyze a broken relationship. The music video is famous for its reverse chronology (which required Chris Martin to learn the song backwards in order to make it look like he was singing forwards as he walked backwards…).

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Come up to meet you, tell you I'm sorry
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Once everything is said and done, we often wish we could turn back time and begin again with a clean slate.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: You don't know how lovely you are
I had to find you, tell you I need you
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: The singer here is not explicitly clear, but his begging may be an indication of what he longs for in his relationship. He wants to have his significant other affirm their love for him, but as the second line indicates, its a bit late for this.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Tell you I set you apart
Tell me your secrets and ask me your questions
Oh, let's go back to the start
Running in circles, coming up tails
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Martin and this girl have been stuck in the same place relationship-wise, doing the same things and drawing the same conclusions. The situation just keeps on getting replayed over and over again and each time, it’s still a problem.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Heads on a science apart
Nobody said it was easy
It's such a shame for us to part
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: This line ties into the song title, “The Scientist,” because it describes what most scientists deal with, numbers, figures, complex puzzles, etc.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Nobody said it was easy
No one ever said it would be this hard
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: When two people are truly in love, break-ups, no matter if mutually agreed on or initiated by one party to another, are rarely smooth and are often tinged with regret. It’s hard to keep the relationship, but it’d be sad for it to end.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Oh, take me back to the start
I was just guessing at numbers and figures
Pulling the puzzles apart
Questions of science, science and progress
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: This problematic pattern never fails to repeat, but that’s part of the relation and is what makes them what they are. Chris compares this cycle to a dog chasing its tail; a common action animals often perform.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Do not speak as loud as my heart
But tell me you love me, come back and haunt me
Oh and I rush to the start
Running in circles, chasing our tails
Coming back as we are
Nobody said it was easy
Oh, it's such a shame for us to part
Nobody said it was easy
No one ever said it would be so hard
I'm going back to the start
